issue.title: Unresolved route Exception causes Codeception unit tests to fail

repository.name: New-Relic
repository.description: This plugin helps instrument your Craft app with New Relic APM by setting transaction names and (optionally) an App Name on each request.

issue.body:
@michaelrog , we noticed that having this plugin enabled was causing our unit and API tests to fail with the following error. 

```sh
Codeception PHP Testing Framework v4.1.22
Powered by PHPUnit 9.5.10 by Sebastian Bergmann and contributors.

In Request.php line 1326:
                                   
  [yii\web\NotFoundHttpException]  
  Page not found.                  
                                   

Exception trace:
  at /app/vendor/craftcms/cms/src/web/Request.php:1326
 craft\web\Request->resolve() at /app/vendor/topshelfcraft/new-relic/src/NewRelic.php:68
 topshelfcraft\newrelic\NewRelic->init() at /app/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/base/BaseObject.php:109
 yii\base\BaseObject->__construct() at /app/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/base/Module.php:158
 yii\base\Module->__construct() at /app/vendor/craftcms/cms/src/base/Plugin.php:115
 craft\base\Plugin->__construct() at n/a:n/a
 ReflectionClass->newInstanceArgs() at /app/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/di/Container.php:420
 yii\di\Container->build() at /app/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/di/Container.php:171
 yii\di\Container->get() at /app/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/BaseYii.php:365
 yii\BaseYii::createObject() at /app/vendor/craftcms/cms/src/Craft.php:67
 Craft::createObject() at /app/vendor/craftcms/cms/src/services/Plugins.php:981
 craft\services\Plugins->createPlugin() at /app/vendor/craftcms/cms/src/services/Plugins.php:233
 craft\services\Plugins->loadPlugins() at /app/vendor/craftcms/cms/src/services/Plugins.php:473
 craft\services\Plugins->installPlugin() at /app/vendor/craftcms/cms/src/test/Craft.php:294
 craft\test\Craft->installPlugin() at /app/vendor/craftcms/cms/src/test/Craft.php:267
 craft\test\Craft->setupDb() at /app/vendor/craftcms/cms/src/test/Craft.php:134
 craft\test\Craft->_beforeSuite() at /app/vendor/codeception/codeception/src/Codeception/Subscriber/Module.php:38
 Codeception\Subscriber\Module->beforeSuite() at /app/vendor/symfony/event-dispatcher/EventDispatcher.php:230
 Symfony\Component\EventDispatcher\EventDispatcher->callListeners() at /app/vendor/symfony/event-dispatcher/EventDispatcher.php:59
 Symfony\Component\EventDispatcher\EventDispatcher->dispatch() at /app/vendor/codeception/codeception/src/Codeception/Event/DispatcherWrapper.php:22
 Codeception\SuiteManager->dispatch() at /app/vendor/codeception/codeception/src/Codeception/SuiteManager.php:159
 Codeception\SuiteManager->run() at /app/vendor/codeception/codeception/src/Codeception/Codecept.php:208
 Codeception\Codecept->runSuite() at /app/vendor/codeception/codeception/src/Codeception/Codecept.php:162
 Codeception\Codecept->run() at /app/vendor/codeception/codeception/src/Codeception/Command/Run.php:532
 Codeception\Command\Run->runSuites() at /app/vendor/codeception/codeception/src/Codeception/Command/Run.php:407
 Codeception\Command\Run->execute() at /app/vendor/symfony/console/Command/Command.php:298
 Symfony\Component\Console\Command\Command->run() at /app/vendor/symfony/console/Application.php:1005
 Symfony\Component\Console\Application->doRunCommand() at /app/vendor/symfony/console/Application.php:299
 Symfony\Component\Console\Application->doRun() at /app/vendor/symfony/console/Application.php:171
 Symfony\Component\Console\Application->run() at /app/vendor/codeception/codeception/src/Codeception/Application.php:117
 Codeception\Application->run() at /app/vendor/codeception/codeception/app.php:46
 {closure}() at /app/vendor/codeception/codeception/app.php:47
 require() at /app/vendor/codeception/codeception/codecept:7

run [-o|--override OVERRIDE] [-e|--ext EXT] [--report] [--html [HTML]] [--xml [XML]] [--phpunit-xml [PHPUNIT-XML]] [--tap [TAP]] [--json [JSON]] [--colors] [--no-colors] [--silent] [--steps] [-d|--debug] [--bootstrap [BOOTSTRAP]] [--no-redirect] [--coverage [COVERAGE]] [--coverage-html [COVERAGE-HTML]] [--coverage-xml [COVERAGE-XML]] [--coverage-text [COVERAGE-TEXT]] [--coverage-crap4j [COVERAGE-CRAP4J]] [--coverage-cobertura [COVERAGE-COBERTURA]] [--coverage-phpunit [COVERAGE-PHPUNIT]] [--no-exit] [-g|--group GROUP] [-s|--skip SKIP] [-x|--skip-group SKIP-GROUP] [--env ENV] [-f|--fail-fast] [--no-rebuild] [--seed SEED] [--no-artifacts] [--] [<suite> [<test>]]


COMMAND DID NOT FINISH PROPERLY.
```

The error is triggered here, https://github.com/craftcms/cms/blob/develop/src/web/Request.php#L1325 where  `Craft::$app->getUrlManager()->parseRequest($this))` resolves to `false`. I quick fix, not sure if the correct fix, would be to wrap 
https://github.com/TopShelfCraft/New-Relic/blob/master/src/NewRelic.php#L68 in a try-catch. 

```php
try {
    $route = $request->resolve();
}
catch (\yii\web\NotFoundHttpException $e) {
    /*
     * Page not found error when
     * Craft::$app->getUrlManager()->parseRequest($request) is false
     */

    $route = "page-not-found";
}

$name = "Console/{$route}";
```

Let me know if you would prefer that I make a PR or better yet if I simply forgot to set a configuration.

body: @michaelrog would you please check @WinterSilence solution? Thanks.

Yes — Setting `isConsoleRequest` in the test bootstrap _does_ "solve" this, in the sense that it addresses this issue with testing. 

Still, I wonder if the current implementation of `isConsoleRequest()` is ideal in the first place. The value of `PHP_SAPI` seems to answer the question: "In what context is PHP running?"

In contrast, `isConsoleRequest()` should answer a different question: "What kind of Request is this?" (referring to the `Request` object)

From that perspective, it seems like `yii\web\Request` and `yii\console\Request` should each define their `$isConsoleRequest` explicitly, independently of `PHP_SAPI`...
